sub_topic: Calculate the scalar curvature of a manifold.
message_1:
Given a manifold with the metric tensor
$$
g_{\mu\nu}=\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3\sin^2\theta \end{pmatrix},
$$
calculate the scalar curvature of this manifold.
message_2:
To calculate the scalar curvature of the manifold, we first need to compute the Christoffel symbols, then the Riemann curvature tensor, the Ricci tensor, and finally the scalar curvature.

The Christoffel symbols are given by:
$$
\Gamma^{\rho}_{\mu\nu} = \frac{1}{2} g^{\rho\sigma} (\partial_{\mu}g_{\nu\sigma} + \partial_{\nu}g_{\mu\sigma} - \partial_{\sigma}g_{\mu\nu})
$$

The inverse metric tensor $g^{\mu\nu}$ is:
$$
g^{\mu\nu}=\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1/2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1/(3\sin^2\theta) \end{pmatrix}
$$

Now, we compute the non-zero Christoffel symbols:
$$
\Gamma^{1}_{22} = \frac{1}{2} g^{11} (\partial_{2}g_{21} + \partial_{2}g_{12} - \partial_{1}g_{22}) = -1
$$
$$
\Gamma^{2}_{12} = \frac{1}{2} g^{22} (\partial_{1}g_{22} + \partial_{2}g_{11} - \partial_{2}g_{12}) = \frac{1}{2}
$$
$$
\Gamma^{3}_{13} = \frac{1}{2} g^{33} (\partial_{1}g_{33} + \partial_{3}g_{11} - \partial_{3}g_{13}) = \frac{1}{3\sin^2\theta}
$$
$$
\Gamma^{3}_{23} = \frac{1}{2} g^{33} (\partial_{2}g_{33} + \partial_{3}g_{22} - \partial_{3}g_{23}) = \frac{\cos\theta}{\sin\theta}
$$

Next, we compute the Riemann curvature tensor:
$$
R^{\rho}_{\sigma\mu\nu} = \partial_{\mu}\Gamma^{\rho}_{\nu\sigma} - \partial_{\nu}\Gamma^{\rho}_{\mu\sigma} + \Gamma^{\rho}_{\mu\lambda}\Gamma^{\lambda}_{\nu\sigma} - \Gamma^{\rho}_{\nu\lambda}\Gamma^{\lambda}_{\mu\sigma}
$$

The non-zero components of the Riemann curvature tensor are:
$$
R^{1}_{212} = \partial_{1}\Gamma^{1}_{22} - \partial_{2}\Gamma^{1}_{12} + \Gamma^{1}_{11}\Gamma^{1}_{22} - \Gamma^{1}_{21}\Gamma^{1}_{12} = 1
$$
$$
R^{2}_{323} = \partial_{2}\Gamma^{3}_{23} - \partial_{3}\Gamma^{3}_{22} + \Gamma^{3}_{21}\Gamma^{2}_{23} - \Gamma^{3}_{23}\Gamma^{2}_{22} = -\frac{1}{2}
$$
$$
R^{3}_{131} = \partial_{1}\Gamma^{3}_{31} - \partial_{3}\Gamma^{3}_{11} + \Gamma^{3}_{11}\Gamma^{1}_{31} - \Gamma^{3}_{31}\Gamma^{1}_{11} = -\frac{1}{3\sin^2\theta}
$$

Now, we compute the Ricci tensor:
$$
R_{\mu\nu} = R^{\rho}_{\mu\rho\nu}
$$

The non-zero components of the Ricci tensor are:
$$
R_{11} = R^{1}_{111} = 0
$$
$$
R_{22} = R^{1}_{212} = 1
$$
$$
R_{33} = R^{2}_{323} + R^{3}_{313} = -\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3\sin^2\theta}
$$

Finally, we compute the scalar curvature:
$$
R = g^{\mu\nu}R_{\mu\nu} = g^{11}R_{11} + g^{22}R_{22} + g^{33}R_{33} = 0 + \frac{1}{2}(1) + \frac{1}{3\sin^2\theta}\left(-\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3\sin^2\theta}\right)
$$
$$
R = \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{6\sin^2\theta} - \frac{1}{9\sin^4\theta}
$$

So, the scalar curvature of the manifold is:
$$
R = \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{6\sin^2\theta} - \frac{1}{9\sin^4\theta}
$$
